name: POTS-1
scenarioDescription:
The POTS-1 Exoplanetary System


Overview

POTS-1 is a star with 0.69 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.59 times its radius. It is located 3913.872 light years away from the solar system.

POTS-1 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the POTS-1 system

POTS-1 b

POTS-1 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the Transit method. The mass of POTS-1 b is 734.16 times the mass of Earth. The radius of POTS-1 b is 10.548 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, POTS-1 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, POTS-1 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system POTS-1, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
